alert.note: Alert for Brooks; Coastal Cameron; Coastal Kenedy; Coastal Willacy; Inland Cameron; Inland Kenedy; Inland Willacy; Jim Hogg; Northern Hidalgo; Southern Hidalgo; Starr; Zapata (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 29 at 3:46PM CDT until March 30 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS EXPECTED WEDNESDAY... .In wake of a cold front Wednesday, brisk northwest surface winds will overspread Deep South Texas and the RGV from late morning through afternoon. Diurnal heating and warming/drying will result in relative humidity values crashing into the 20s to 30s from western sections all the way to the coast. Strong surface winds, dry fuels, and low relative humidity values will support critical fire weather conditions. Confidence for critical fire weather parameters are well above average. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 8 PM CDT WEDNESDAY FOR WINDS, DRY FUELS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY VALUES FOR PORTIONS OF DEEP SOUTH TEXAS... * AFFECTED AREA...Zapata, Jim Hogg, Brooks, Inland Kenedy, Starr, Southern Hidalgo, Inland Willacy, Inland Cameron, Coastal Willacy, Coastal Cameron, Coastal Kenedy, and Northern Hidalgo Counties. * TIMING...10 AM to Wednesday. * WIND...Northwest 15 to 25 mph. * HUMIDITY...Near 20 percent west of Interstate highway 69 C, 25 to 30 percent east of Interstate 69 C to the immediate coast. * IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means critical fire weather conditions are occurring now...or will shortly. In general...these conditions include sustained 20 foot winds of 25 MPH or greater...humidity ranging from below 25 percent in Zapata County to below 45 percent along the coast...each lasting for 2 hours or longer... and cured fuels. Humidity below 25 percent in most areas will trigger fire danger at lower wind speeds. Detailed decision tables are found at HTTP://WEATHER.GOV/RGV/?N=MAPCOLORS#FIRE.
